Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: PERFORATION OBSERVATION NUMBER: Assigned number to uniquely identify aperforation activity or interval in a well.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: BASE DEPTH: Measured depth from the surface to the base of the perforations.
Column Comment.5: BASE DEPTH OUOM: Base measured depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.6: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.7: COMPLETION OBSERVATION NUMBER: A sequential observation number used touniquely identify each completed (perforated) interval.
Column Comment.8: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.9: COMPLETION STATUS: A reference table identifying the status type of acompletion. For example open, closed, intermittent, squeeze, plugged orindeterminate.
Column Comment.10: COMPLETION STATUS TYPE: This reference table defines the group or type ofstatus, such as construction, financial, legal etc.
Column Comment.11: CURRENT STATUS DATE: Date associated with the current status of the wellperforations.
Column Comment.12: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.13: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.14: PERFORATION ANGLE: For directional perforating this is the angle of perforationsexpressed in degrees relative to north.
Column Comment.15: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate, such as aperson, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium.
Column Comment.16: PERFORATION COUNT: Total number of perforations or holes pierced through thecasing or liner.
Column Comment.17: PERFORATION DATE: Date the perforation was performed.
Column Comment.18: PERFORATION DENSITY: Number of perforations used in combination withperforations per unit. For example 8.5 shots per metre with 17 shots every 2 meters.
Column Comment.19: PERFORATION DIAMETER: The size or diameter of the perforations.
Column Comment.20: PERFORATION DIAMETER OUOM: Perforation diameter original unit of measure.
Column Comment.21: PERFORATION METHOD: Code identifying the type of opening the fluid enteredthrough into the tubing (e.g., perforation, open hole, combination, etc.).
Column Comment.22: PERFORATION PER UNIT OF MEASURE: Identifies the measurement used for theperforation interval. Combined with perforation count indicates the number ofperforations per interval.
Column Comment.23: PERFORATION PHASE: The angle separating perforations. For example 120 or 180
Column Comment.24: PERFORATION TYPE: A reference table identifying the type of perforation method.For example bullet, jet or combination.
Column Comment.25: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.26: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.27: STRAT NAME SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the stratigraphic name set. Astratigraphic name set is an unordered collection of stratigraphic units, that may be inuse for a Lexicon, a geographic area, a project, a company etc..
Column Comment.28: TOP DEPTH: Measured depth from the surface to the top of the perforations.
Column Comment.29: TOP DEPTH OUOM: Top measured depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.30: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.31: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.32: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.33: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.34: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.35: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.36: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.37: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
